sql.statement: select p.id as _id, package_name, version, title, description, release_date, license, url, copyright, p.created_at, p.updated_at, sourceJSON, m.name as `maintainer.name`, m.email as `maintainer.email`, c.name as `collaborators.name`, c.email as `collaborators.email` from PackageVersions p LEFT OUTER JOIN Collaborators m ON p.maintainer_id = m.id LEFT OUTER JOIN Collaborations ca ON ca.`authored_version_id` = p.id LEFT OUTER JOIN Collaborators c on c.id = ca.author_id INNER JOIN es_jobs j on p.id = j.version_id WHERE j._job = ? ORDER BY p.id;
